verses.verse: (Ps. 25:8; 37:39, 40; 100:5; (Jer. 33:11); Lam. 3:25) The LORD is good, A stronghold in the day of trouble; And (Ps. 1:6; John 10:14; 2 Tim. 2:19) He knows those who trust in Him.
But with an overflowing flood He will make an utter end of its place, And darkness will pursue His enemies.
(Ps. 2:1; Nah. 1:11) What do you conspire against the LORD? (1 Sam. 3:12) He will make an utter end of it. Affliction will not rise up a second time.
For while tangled (2 Sam. 23:6; Mic. 7:4) like thorns, (Is. 56:12; Nah. 3:11) And while drunken like drunkards, (Is. 5:24; 10:17; Mal. 4:1) They shall be devoured like stubble fully dried.
From you comes forth one Who plots evil against the LORD, A wicked counselor.

Thus says the LORD: “Though they are safe, and likewise many, Yet in this manner they will be ((Is. 10:16-19, 33, 34)) cut down When he passes through. Though I have afflicted you, I will afflict you no more;
For now I will break off his yoke from you, And burst your bonds apart.”

The LORD has given a command concerning you: “Your name shall be perpetuated no longer. Out of the house of your gods I will cut off the carved image and the molded image. I will dig your (Ezek. 32:22, 23) grave, For you are (Nah. 3:6) vile.”

Behold, on the mountains The (Is. 40:9; 52:7; Rom. 10:15) feet of him who brings good tidings, Who proclaims peace! O Judah, keep your appointed feasts, Perform your vows. For the wicked one shall no more pass through you; He is (Is. 29:7, 8) utterly cut off.
The Destruction of Nineveh He who scatters has come up before your face. Man the fort! Watch the road! Strengthen your flanks! Fortify your power mightily.
For the LORD will restore the excellence of Jacob Like the excellence of Israel, For the emptiers have emptied them out And ruined their vine branches.
The shields of his mighty men are made red, The valiant men are in scarlet. The chariots come with flaming torches In the day of his preparation, And the spears are brandished.
The chariots rage in the streets, They jostle one another in the broad roads; They seem like torches, They run like lightning.
